Question: What symbol is used to denote an ID selector in CSS syntax?
Reason: An ID selector in CSS is denoted by the '#' symbol followed by the ID name.

Question: What is the correct syntax for applying an external CSS file to an HTML document?
Reason: The correct syntax for applying an external CSS file to an HTML document is '<link rel='stylesheet' href='styles.css'>'.

Reason: The 'color' property is used to change the color of text in CSS syntax.

Question: How do you select all elements with a class of 'button' in CSS syntax?
Reason: To select all elements with a class of 'button' in CSS syntax, you use '.button'.

Question: What is the correct way to add a comment in CSS syntax?
Reason: The correct way to add a comment in CSS syntax is '/* This is a comment */'.

Reason: The 'background-color' property is used to change the background color of an element in CSS syntax.

Question: How do you select all <a> elements within a <nav> element in CSS syntax?
Reason: To select all <a> elements within a <nav> element in CSS syntax, you use 'nav a'.

Question: What is the CSS syntax for setting the font size to 16 pixels?
Reason: The CSS syntax for setting the font size to 16 pixels is 'font-size: 16px;'.

Question: How do you select the first child element of a parent in CSS syntax?
Reason: To select the first child element of a parent in CSS syntax, you use ':first-child'.

Reason: The 'font-family' property is used to specify the font family in CSS syntax.

Question: What CSS property is used to set the text alignment to center?
Reason: The CSS property used to set the text alignment to center is 'text-align: center;'.

Question: How do you select all even rows in a table using CSS syntax?
Reason: To select all even rows in a table using CSS syntax, you use ':nth-child(even)'.

Reason: The 'padding' property is used to add space between the content and the border of an element in CSS syntax.

Reason: To select all elements with a class of 'highlight' within a <div> element in CSS syntax, you use 'div .highlight'.

Reason: To select all <li> elements that are descendants of an element with the ID 'menu' in CSS syntax, you use '#menu li'.

Reason: The CSS syntax for setting the text decoration to underline is 'text-decoration: underline;'.

Reason: To select the first paragraph within an element with the class 'content' in CSS syntax, you use '.content p:first-child'.

Reason: The correct CSS syntax for setting the margin on all sides of an element to 10 pixels is 'margin: 10px;'.

Reason: To select all elements with the attribute 'target' in CSS syntax, you use '[target]'.

Question: How do you select all <input> elements with the 'type' attribute set to 'text' in CSS syntax?
Reason: To select all <input> elements with the 'type' attribute set to 'text' in CSS syntax, you use 'input[type='text']'.
